intro: Impatiens radiata, commonly known as the "whitewash plant," is a species of flowering plant in the family Balsaminaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that come in a range of colors including white, pink, and red. The plant typically grows as an annual or short-lived perennial, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered with fine hairs, while its flowers are borne in clusters at the tips of the stems. Impatiens radiata thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade, making it a popular choice for shady garden beds and container gardening.
